title: Ezra Jack Keats Storytime*
description: *Meets alternating Mondays: 10/7, 10/21, 11/4, 11/18. Enjoy a story by author/illustrator Ezra Jack Keats, make a related craft, and pick out a free book to keep!

title: Storytime
description: Join us in a world of wonder and imagination at our weekly community story time for little ones ages 0-4 and their grownups! This enchanting experience, led by our enthusiastic and engaging teaching artists/actors will be sure to captivate our youngest adventurers. We will introduce new favorites and familiar tales, and have some time for free play and connection in our cozy space.

title: Mini-Musicians
description: Class featuring a mixture of classic preschool songs and Mr. Lincoln’s original children’s music, as well as songs and activities designed to get children exploring music making of their own.

title: Brooklyn Baby Bops

title: Tuesday Morning Music
description: Registration suggested.  We'll be sharing songs with folks of all ages in this cross-generational singalong. Come down to Jalopy to sing, dance, or even just to hang out and listen. We'll keep things easy-going as we slowly get the music flowing again.

title: Mommy & Me
description: Chabad of Dumbo has A Mommy and me program that will enable mothers and their babies from across the neighborhood to meet, socialize, learn and create a community.  Esther, the Director of the Dumbo Gan and mother of six will share a short teaching and parenting insight distilled from Jewish tradition to lend wisdom, perspective and guidance into parenting.

title: Adults with Babies (Nitehawk)

title: SAHP Meetup

title: Toddler Open Play
description: Ditmas Park Toddler Playtime lets your toddler enjoy unstructured playtime at the gym, where they can swing on the bars, balance on beam, and jump on the trampoline. An instructor will be present, but please ensure your child is supervised by an adult. No sign-up necessary. Payment in cash or Venmo is required upon arrival.

title: Postnatal Yoga: Parent + Baby
description: After 50 minutes of flowing yoga we will focus on bonding with our new babes through infant massage and gentle stretching. Open to all parents and caregivers once you are cleared for gentle exercise. Suggested age for infants is 6 weeks old up to crawlers. Bring an extra baby blanket for your babe to chill on.

title: Toddler Time with Carroll Gardens Library
description: Join Ms. Sarah every Wednesday at St. Paul's Episcopal Church (199 Carroll St, Brooklyn, NY 11231) for a Toddler Time program. There will be songs, rhymes, fingerplays, and books! This program is geared towards ages 18-36months and their caregivers.

title: First Discoveries
description: Restarting March 12th. Calling all nature explorers up to 5 years old (and their caregivers)! Pot up a plant, create a craft, read a story, and use your senses to explore nature at special Discovery Garden activity stations designed for early learners. Included with Garden admission.

title: Toddler Time
description: This is a program for walking toddlers. Lapsit storytime for infants who are not yet walking should attend Babies and Books on Thursdays!

title: Green-Wood on Wheels: Stroller-Friendly Walking Tour
description: In partnership with Park Slope Parents, this leisurely walk is a chance to soak in the Cemetery's beauty, connect with fellow grown-ups, and discover the stories that make Green-Wood so special. It's fresh air, fun facts, and a perfect excuse to get rolling—all at a baby-friendly pace! The material in this tour is intended for adults and is not designed to be child-friendly. All children should either be in a stroller or carrier.
